arch:property.oc:show_val: Phase V: Late Nabataean CE 1st c. redesign and repairs, including the addition of the Theater, intercolumnar walls, Central Arch and platform, East and West Interior Staircases and landings, East and West Vaulted Chambers, and the East and West Rear Staircases. Limestone pavement is laid on all new floor areas.
Central Stone in Locus 4— Orchestra Retaining Wall

The architects in the design of the Theatron used a single stone in the center of Locus 4 as a vertical center point. Locus 13 provides the same service on the horizontal plane. It can only be assumed that it was necessary to have a vertical center point as well as a horizontal one. This stone was removed for investigatory purposes, and later replaced.
In the center of Locus 4— Orchestra Retaining Wall
